basics.name: Srinivasan Dhanaraj
basics.label: Metallurgist
basics.summary: Masters in Metallurgy and Integrated Computational Materials Engineering with more than 10 years of relavent industry experience

work.name: Bharat Forge Ltd, Pune
work.summary: Turbocharger, Aerospace and Defence Project for Indian Railways and Defense: Gained experience in diverse manufacturing processes including heat treatment, plating, coating, and casting (ferrous and non-ferrous).

work.name: Honda Cars R&D (HGID), Gr Noida
work.summary: At Honda Cars, as part of the Material Research Team in Research and Development, I focused on new material research for light weighting and optimising metallurgical processes.

work.name: Ford Motor Company, Chennai
work.summary: At Ford Motors, was part of the International Markets Group as Technical Specialist for Castings, Forgings, Raw Materials.

work.name: The Automotive Research Association of India, Pune
work.summary: Currently working on New Material Research through ICME approach, AI & ML for Materials, Material Infomatics.

courses: Phase Field, AI & ML, Atomistic Modeling, ICME, Thermodynamics
Metallurgy, Castings, Forging, Heat Treatment, Steel Making, Thermodynamics

awards.title: Asia West Steel Champion
awards.summary: steelChallenge-18 utilised steeluniversity’s electric arc furnace steelmaking and secondary steelmaking in a combined simulation. Participants were tasked to produce a grade of steel meeting technical requirements at the lowest cost per tonne with carbon footprint requirements.'

awards.title: World Steel Champion
awards.summary: Finalist of Regional Champions are invited to compete for the World Championship Titile. I have emerged as World Champion.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
